column4: In this line of code, "glc-play [stream file] -o - -a NUM | lame -hV2 - audio.mp3" what do the lone "-" mean?
sudo dumpe2fs -h /dev/sdXY | grep Reserved          change sdXY to your drive
if that fs just contains data, set reserved space to 0 (tune2fs -m0)
Do I need to input my /dev/sdb1 in the command as well?

that happens whenever you create a ext2/3/4 fs, since those stupid 5% are reserved by default. you can use mkfs.ext4 -m0 to prevent it (or tune2fs later). that reserved space makes only sense for / or /tmp + /var
Ahh, I see. Good to know :)
Thank you again. Very very good to know. :)
Is there any special command to erase what exists on it or do I just do as I would to put a new one on there?
if you create a new filesystem, all old stuff will be erased
